title.english: YATAGARASU: The Raven Does Not Choose Its Master

description:
Welcome to Yamauchi, a world inhabited by the Yatagarasu, a race of three-legged ravens who shapeshift into humans. The land is divided into four regions—North, South, East, and West—each ruled by a noble family. Yukiya, the son of a leader in the North, is shocked by a call to attend to the Imperial Prince. Murder, mysteries, and an invasion from an unexpected enemy await in this epic fantasy.

(Source: Crunchyroll)

tags.name: Royal Affairs
tags.description: Features nobility, alliances, arranged marriage, succession disputes, religious orders and other elements of royal politics.

tags.name: Conspiracy
tags.description: Contains one or more factions controlling or attempting to control the world from the shadows.

tags.name: Shapeshifting
tags.description: Features character(s) who changes one's appearance or form.

tags.name: Politics
tags.description: Centers around politics, politicians, or government activities.

tags.name: Primarily Adult Cast
tags.description: Main cast is mostly composed of characters above a high school age.

tags.name: Assassins
tags.description: Centers around characters who murder people as a profession.

tags.name: Estranged Family
tags.description: At least one family member of the MC intentionally distances themselves or a family distances themselves from a person related to the MC.

tags.name: Ojou-sama
tags.description: Features a wealthy, high-class, oftentimes stuck up and demanding female character.

tags.name: Adoption
tags.description: Features a character who has been adopted by someone who is neither of their biological parents.

tags.name: Philosophy
tags.description: Relating or devoted to the study of the fundamental nature of knowledge, reality, and existence.

tags.name: Swordplay
tags.description: Prominently features the use of swords in combat.

tags.name: Ensemble Cast
tags.description: Features a large cast of characters with (almost) equal screen time and importance to the plot.

tags.name: Gore
tags.description: Prominently features graphic bloodshed and violence.

tags.name: Mythology
tags.description: Prominently features mythological elements, especially those from religious or cultural tradition.

tags.name: Anthropomorphism
tags.description: Contains non-human character(s) that have attributes or characteristics of a human being.

tags.name: Augmented Reality
tags.description: Prominently features events with augmented reality as the main setting.

alternative: おおむらさきのおまえ

node.description:
Born in Gunma Prefecture in 1991.

 At age 20, while studying at Waseda University in Tokyo, she won the Matsumoto-Seicho Prize, one of the most prestigious prizes in literature for novels in Japan, as the youngest recipient in its history for her first novel "Karasu ni Hitoe wa Niawanai".

In 2017, she completed her master's degree at Waseda University Graduate School of Letters. She later awarded Yoshikawa Eiji literary prize for her series—"Yatagarasu".

Her other works include `"Hatsugen'' (lit. Manifestation)

Akiko Shikata is a singer-songwriter and composer. She was born in Tokyo, Japan.  She's known for her contribution in the video game series Ar Tonelico and Shadow Hearts.  She also gave her contribution on Umineko no Naku Koro ni musics, such as the OP Theme for the Visual Novel and the Anime.  Recently she released her second maxi single, Inori no Kanata, that is Tales of Symphonia TETHE'ALLA Hen ED Theme.  She sings in multiple languages such as Italian, German, English, Celtic and Hymmnos, Ar Tonelico's Official Language.
